column1: The RSGS was founded in 1884 as an educational trust
column2: and education is still a fundamental remit of the Society.

column4: support for geography-teaching in Scotland's schools and universities
column6: the Society promotes the quality and growth of geographical and environmental education in Scotland.

column1: The RSGS works closely with the Scottish Association of Geography Teachers (SAGT) in promoting the teaching of geography in schools.   In particular
column2: the Society supports keynote speakers at the annual SAGT conference
column4: the John Bartholomew Essay Competition (see also below)
column5: and the production of educational resources.
